data: To be ordered by Surgical Services only. Not for Medical Imaging use

Consider the following exclusion criteria for therapeutic oral gastrografin:  
 -Complicated small bowel obstruction (malignant, signs of bowel ischemia, perforation, peritonitis)  
-Pregnancy
-Symptomatic hyperthyroidism 
-Allergy to iodine
-Aspiration risks: advanced age, frailty, hiatus hernia, COPD/home oxygen, neurologic disorder impacting swallowing
GASTROGRAFIN does not come from pharmacy. GASTROGRAFIN (diatrizoate meglumine-diatrizoate sodium) is a water-soluble contrast agent NOT a medication. Obtain agent from Medical Imaging/Stores
T;N, For 1 hour following administration of gastrografin monitor, q15 min
T;N, Insert peripheral IV Catheter if one is not present/accessible
For patients with NG tube (for VGH only)
Suction type: Low Continuous Suction, Decompress stomach via NG tube 2 hours before administration of GASTROGRAFIN
T;N, Prior to administration of GASTROGRAFIN, Nurse to ensure:  -NG tube has been inserted and placement confirmed by MD -NG tube placed on suction for over 4 hours
T;N, Except with sips of clear fluids

T;N+480, Timed, Reason: 8 hours post GASTROGRAFIN administration, Special Instructions: Supine and upright.  If no contrast is present in the colon, order a second abdominal XR 24 hours post GASTROGRAFIN, call results. If administered after 1600, delay XR until 0800 the following morning
T+1;N, Timed, Reason: 24 hours post GASTROGRAFIN administration, Special Instructions: Supine and upright, Call Results
100 mL, PO, once, drug form: oral liq
100 mL, NG-tube, once, drug form: oral liq
T;N, GASTROGRAFIN must be protected from light until immediately prior to dose preparation and patient administration. Patients receiving GASTROGRAFIN must have an IV
T;N, Nursing to stay with patient until total dose is administered either orally or by NG tube
